resources.string: Apply custom fonts on a Per-App Basis (zst123)
Applications are still being loaded, please wait.
Fonts will be loaded from this folder on boot-up:\n
Replace the font for every app that doesn\'t have a setting with the one specified for Android System. \nEnabling this could degrade performance.
Force kill this app?\n(Requires Superuser Permission)

Changing Android System font does not change the entire system fonts. It only changes views in the framework like the Lockscreen, App-Not-Responding & Battery Low Dialogs etc.\n To change the entire system font with the Android System, you may find it in \'Preferences\' from the main screen.
This module replaces fonts at a very low level. Some apps might continue to show their own fonts that\'s bundled in it. To prevent this, enable Force Fonts
A Reboot is required for the fonts to take effect in Android System
You might need to force kill the app for changes to take effect.
If an app continues to show their own fonts, use this to force it at the expense of some performance. This replaces the fonts at a higher level.
